intro: Aconogonon amgense, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, giving it a daisy-like appearance. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Aconogonon amgense is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
